document.title: Class View and Object Browser Features

paragraph.paragraph: Feature nodes are visable from expanding a classes.xmlClass Node or expanding one of the subnodes under an expanded feature node. There are many different types of url*feature in Eiffel, for a full glossary of the features and their associated icon representation in the index.xmlClass View and url*Object Browser please refer to the eiffel_icons.xmlEiffel Icon documentation.
If you do not already know what a url*feature is in Eiffel please refer to the url*Eiffel for .NET Langauge documentation.
Expanding a feature node displays statuary information on the feature and it's use within the project. The display items are listed below:

Ancestor version ../images/feature/hier_feature_ancestors.png
A flattened list of all redefined versions of the expanded feature.

Decendent version ../images/feature/hier_feature_descendents.png
A flattened list of all decented versions of the expanded feature.

Callers ../images/feature/hier_feature_callers.png
A flattened list of all features that in turn call the expanded feature.

Implementers ../images/feature/hier_feature_implementers.png
When expanded a flattened list of all homogeneous features will be displayed.

If you need to direct the ../../eiffel_editor/index.xmlEiffel Editor to any feature found in the index.xmlClass View, a double-left mouse click on a corresponding feature node will open the url*Eiffel class in the editor and move the feature into view.
Note: The index.xmlClass View will show .NET types when using the facilities to browse classes.xmlclass and feature url*ancestors, url*decendents, etc. Attempt to locate the related source will instead open the ../object_browser/index.xmlObject Browser and located the appropriate node given the assembly, type and feature.
